question: How did you decide to present trials?
details: adaptive N could include online exclusion of bad trials that are re-presented again later, or addition of extra trials on the basis of online subjective data quality checks, or using a threshold of participant behaviour (i.e., learning effect or attention checks).
choices: fixed N of trials delivered | adaptive N of trails (please explain) | Other (please explain)

question: How many trials (in total) did you include in your task?
details: total number of trials (including repetition of the same trials)

question: How many (within-subjects) conditions did you include in your task?
details: number of conditions for trials (different types of trials - not groups of participants)

question: How many trials did you use for each condition?
details: insert the number of trials per condition, separated by semicolon for each new condition (e.g. 30;90). Please specify the order of conditions in the further clarification field.

question: In your final analysis, how many trials, on average, did you include for each condition?
details: insert the average N of trials which was analyzed per condition, separated by semicolon for each new condition (e.g. 23.6;88.2). Please follow the same order of conditions as in the field 5.1.3. If there are multiple groups of participants, please provide this information per group in the Further Clarification section.

question: Please insert the minimum number of trials analysed per condition:
details: insert the minimum N of trials which was analyzed per condition, separated by semicolon for each new condition (e.g. 21;72). Please follow the same order of conditions as in the field 5.1.3. If there are multiple groups of participants, please provide this information per group in the Further Clarification section.

question: Please insert the maximum number of trials analysed per condition:
details: insert the maximum N of trials which was analyzed per condition, separated by semicolon for each new condition (e.g. 29;79). Please follow the same order of conditions as in the field 5.1.3. If there are multiple groups of participants, please provide this information per group in the Further Clarification section.

question: How many subjects participated in our study?
How many participants, in total, did you include in your analyses, after exclusion of bad data?
How many experimental/comparison (between-subjects) groups did you have?
details: Number of subsets.  Input numeric value

question: How many participants in each experimental/comparison groups did you use?
details: Input numeric values separated by semicolon (e.g. 15;15;15). Please specify the order of groups in the Further Clarification section.

question: Specify the order of the group
details: Input the group name in the same order with previous answer, separated by semicolon (e.g. control group; test group)

question: Which presenting software did you use to show your experimental task?
